text:
Hi everyone,

I need some help with a problem I'm having in HubSpot. I'm using the "Bomby" template, and while the menu appears perfectly on desktop, it's not showing up on mobile. Has anyone encountered this issue before or have any suggestions on how to fix it?

Thanks in advance!
have you tried opening a ticket to the theme creator?
where did you get the template from? Just asking because "Bomby" is not available in the official marketplace

Hi Team,
I need to add the custom content module "Trial Request Pop-Up" to the pop-up CTA.
Module: <https://app.HubSpot.com/design-manager/20892451/modules/168663704465>
Please advise on the implementation process.
I have created the pop-up CTA "Instant Trial popup": <https://app.HubSpot.com/calls-to-action/20267955/details/170847863828/performance>, but I cannot see the option for content selection on the following landing page: <https://app.HubSpot.com/pages/20267955/editor/170848230204/content?utm_source=sprocket-menu>
Please let me know how to proceed.

Hello HubSpot dev community! While this isn’t a support space, we do know some channels, including especially beta channels, do provide HubSpotter feedback and support. So, we wanted to give you all a heads up:

:HubSpot: :palm_tree: *From Monday July 1st through Friday July 5th inclusively, all of HubSpot will be closed for our annual restorative week of rest.* There will be core support working the frontlines, but not much more from us that week. We hope you get a chance to relax and restore yourselves this summer! 

We’ll be back and raring to go on July 8th :) :palm_tree: :sprocket-dance:

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!

Hey team, is it possible to allow cross-domain access to serverless functions for domains connected in one account? With CMS Hub Enterprise and the ability to host multiple sites, we want to be able to call serverless functions from any of the connected domains. is that possible?
